properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 9:46PM PST until February 3 at 3:19AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County
Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County
Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County
Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County

The second push of heavy rain will move over the area tonight into
Saturday morning. This combined with the 4 to 5 inches from the first
round will push the Noocksack and Snohomish rivers abvoe flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Nooksack River At Ferndale
* from late tonight to late Sunday night.
* At  9:15 PM Friday the stage was 14.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 6 AM
Saturday and crest near 20.2 feet around 4 AM Sunday. The river
will fall below flood stage Sunday evening.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, the river will flood additional areas within
the City of Ferndale including low-lying residential areas and
roads including Washington Street, Portal Way and Second Avenue.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
